title: Drastic ping changes from overseas
body:
Hi, having moved to Singapore, I've been playing League via internet cafe at 105 ping flat. From my home connection, the OCE server has been at 210 ping flat.
These have been the ping values for the past month or so, however just today the internet cafe I frequent became a concurrent 200 ping while my home internet has risen to 340.  Another internet cafe I've been to rose similarly from 120 to 240.
Would there be any reason as to this seemingly uniform increase in ping while accessing the OCE servers?
Because all three places I've accessed here are under different ISPs.
If someone knowledgeable of certain happenings from Riot or just tech-savvy individuals could help me out I'd really appreciate it

replies.body: happens in hk and overseas as well :/

Hey there, 

Could you please download [WinMTR](http://downloads.sourceforge.net/project/winmtr/WinMTR-v092.zip) and run a traceroute to the following IP address (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes), export the results as text and reply back with them (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this.)

>103.240.227.5

Could I also get you to run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/) and post back with a link to your results page.

You mentioned you were connecting from Asia? Your problems may be being caused by the issue described by Agent Mindstar [here](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-oce/GYiftAVf-is-anyone-getting-massive-lag-that-wont-stop?comment=00010000).
I'll be going to the internet cafe tomorrow so I'll run this there and post the results from home and there in one post, if that's alright.
